alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 7:30PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Molokai in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 945 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 PM HST, heavy rainfall is easing over eastern Molokai, but the Halawa Stream continues to rise. Additional heavy rainfall will move ashore by 800 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ualapue, Pukoo, Kamalo, Halawa Valley, Kalaupapa National Park and Kawela. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 945 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
